channel.title: Motivation
channel.description:
What keeps you guys motivated to code and stay in this community? In case you're wondering what keeps me motivated, NOTHING. I have no motivation, just My Soul Your Beats (Angel Beats Intro Song.) :p and the exception of thinking how far I can make it in this community with Java, in percentage of me being successful in this community is a 0.1% (:
The song I listen to while I code. xD http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rv9vism5f80 It's not just this song, I listen to Electronic, Hip Hop, mostly every single genre of music. I like Logic - Inception. :P I will make a thread of my favorite songs if you're interested, but you're probably not because no one cares about Junior Members. AND THATS A FACT. (in the book of Moparians.) Have a good day.

item.title: Motivation
item.dc:creator: @Jaxus Jaxus
item.description:
@Jaxus wrote:

DevotionPk:

Fapping.

You post something immature on just about every single topic you reply to.

OT: My motivation has been slowly degrading since the beginning of this year. I have a job, bigger responsibilities, one of the most important years in my academic life and this leaves me little time to work with anything computer related. I started off in this community a few years ago on a different account, which I originally used this site for RSPS related material. That eventually turned me into the average RSPS member, which usually possesses little to no knowledge about actual programming using a language such as Java. As I started to get older and realize that I would never have a successful server until I learned Java. Ever since then, I’ve been researching different computer related material to further my knowledge of numerous things, but as I’ve already mentioned, I don’t have a lot of time to do this anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Motivation
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

You said something about not making it far without java… Umm… While web developers may be the minority in this community they’re still here. Aspire to gain the badge such as I did.

Read full topic

item.title: Motivation
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

If i’m not mistaken, there has been several threads created about motivation and whatnot.

Anyway, to be honest, I don’t really have any motivation. If I mess with anything RSPS related, it’s during my free-time, and even then I don’t enjoy it as much as I used to (2-3 years ago). I just like to see my finished result(s) after completing a project. So basically, I force myself to do so.

Read full topic

item.title: Motivation
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote="`Aaron, post:4, topic:460897"][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=563830.msg4107744#msg4107744 date=1348183364]
I lost motivation ages ago. I barely even post anymore. Yet somehow, life moves on.
[/quote]

You speak the truth my friend, took the words out of my mouth. I still visit because a part of me is still holding on to the on-line world, i can barely find any time to make it here anymore.[/quote]

Glad I’m not the only one who seems to be fading away. A new generation is moving in, and slowly knowledge of us will fade.

Read full topic

item.title: Motivation
item.dc:creator: @Nebulae Nebulae
item.description:
@Nebulae wrote:

Just the satisfaction of creating new and unique features. I don’t code hard nowadays anyway because I have a family that takes up the majority of my time, but I enjoy developing in the evenings, even if no one gets to experience my server ( I never release anything I create).

Read full topic
